column5: My son Griffin has been eagerly awaiting bass opener here in southern ontario. We have a great time most years with lots of willing fish and never really run into other anglers.  The late spring and high water(plus thunderstorms off and on) really put the fish down. Water was a high and relatively dirty.  He managed 5 "keepers" of 12" or better while I got only one. I probably won't hear the end of it all weekend.  Heres his best fish a 19"       A short video of landing it in the pouring rain     A couple of fawns came down to check out his bass fishing prowess.   All fish were caught on Watermelon Yamamoto flappin hogs that were split shot rigged.
Awesome!!! Wicked fish and looks like a great time!!!
Really nice river bass!  Love when deer drop in for a visit.
Nice fish. I was out for some river bass . Tried many different fly patterns,not a sniff,but when I switched up to catch some smaller trout,I hit many. Skeeters were killer.
Yup every time the rain let up the mozzy's came out
Nice Smallies & love the Deer dropping in, bet you wouldn't have the Butt kicking any other way lol Tight Lines SBK
That's the way to have a opener in the water with your son.
